user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_get_size:
```c
_MHD_static_inline unsigned int
digest_get_size (struct DigestAlgorithm *da)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->uninitialised);
  mhd_assert (da->algo_selected);
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5 == da->algo)
    return MD5_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256 == da->algo)
    return SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256 == da->algo)
    return SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
  mhd_assert (0); /* May not happen */
  return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256 == da->algo)
    return SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment is conditionally compiled and contains a runtime conditional that is reachable when MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT is defined and da->algo equals MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256. There is no statically unreachable code introduced by this snippet. (Note: the final mhd_assert(0) may never be reached in normal operation if every supported algorithm returns earlier, but that is a defensive check rather than unreachable code mandated by the project.)
